Task 8
## Motivation

- Explore development indicators from the World Bank WDI
- Focus on GDP per capita, life expectancy, and inflation


## Data

- Dataset: World Development Indicators (WDI)
- Unit of analysis: countries (and potentially years)


## Key Findings

- GDP per capita shows large dispersion across countries
- Life expectancy is more tightly clustered
- Inflation has outliers (high-volatility episodes)


## Conclusion

- Economic development correlates with health outcomes
- Results motivate deeper country/region segmentation


Task 9
## GDP vs Life Expectancy

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| label: fig-slides-gdp-life
#| fig-cap: "GDP per capita vs life expectancy (WDI)."

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")

plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["life_expectancy"], df["gdp_per_capita"])
plt.title("GDP per Capita vs Life Expectancy")
plt.xlabel("life_expectancy")
plt.ylabel("gdp_per_capita")
plt.show()
```
